casebody.data:
Hugh Markham v. The State. No. 19178. Delivered November 10, 1937.

*248The opinion states the case.

Leo Darley, of Dallas, for appellant. Lloyd W. Davidson, State’s Attorney, of Austin, for the State. HAWKINS, Judge. —

Conviction is for theft of an auto over the value of fifty dollars, punishment being assessed at two years in the penitentiary.

Appellant entered a plea of guilty. The State’s evidence supports the plea. No evidence was offered by appellant. No bills of exception are brought forward.

The judgment is affirmed.

Affirmed.
